com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface LayerInfo

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseLayerInfo
Deprecated. - the class has been deprecated, see Content API.

public interface LayerInfo
extends Comparable

Describes a Layer that is made available by a LayerSource. It extends Comparable because a LayerSource will normally return these LayerInfo objects in sorted order for getLayerInfo(). LayerInfo also allows you to easily get access to the underlying MapDataset of a Layer.

When a LayerSource constructs a Layer using getLayer or getLayers() it will initially set the LayerCapabilities based upon the return values of isAvailable() isEnabled() and isEnablingAllowed()

See Also:
LayerSource.getLayerInfo()

setDisplayFont

public void setDisplayFont(Font font)
Deprecated. 
Sets the font that can be used to display the layer name and other details such as Renderer (for FeatureLayer) in a user interface, such as Legend or Catalog. Usually this font is obtained from an ArcIMS service, and is to assist multi-lingual capabilities of the ArcIMS client. If the client does not actually have the required font, it is expected that a default font will be used, and that a warning message will already have been sent to the MessageCentre - calling code need not detect the presence or absence of this font.

Parameters:
font - the display font

getDisplayFont

Usually this font is obtained from an ArcIMS service, and is to assist multi-lingual capabilities of the ArcIMS client. If the client does not actually have the required font, it is expected that a default font will be used, and that a warning message will already have been sent to the MessageCentre - calling code need not detect the presence or absence of this font.

the display font

setLocale

public void setLocale(Locale locale)
Deprecated.
